<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 3"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Improvised Repair](/Feats.aspx?ID=6486) <actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=615" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 231 <sup>1.1</sup>

</column>

---

You can hastily patch damaged equipment together, but the temporary fix lacks the full care required for lasting repairs. You patch together a broken item possessed by you or an adjacent willing creature. Until the item takes damage again, it still functions as a [shoddy](/Rules.aspx?ID=2162) item of its type. If it's a magic item or another item with activations, it can't be activated while patched together, but can be used for normal functions (such as [Striking](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306) with a weapon or using [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=5212) with a shield). This activity restores no Hit Points, so the item is easy to [destroy](/Rules.aspx?ID=2160) . Once the item is [Repaired](/Actions.aspx?ID=2384) normally such that it is no longer [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=60), it is also no longer shoddy.
name: Improvised Repair
